page.title: 01Winwick and Environs
page.content: Winwick is a small village of about 30 households, disposed around the Thurming - Hamerton, Gidding - Old Weston crossroads, with some houses as much as 1km from the crossroads. The surrounding area in the 12km block is agricultural, largely for sheep, but some cattle are fattened. The farms many, in size from a few acres for pigs to the larger of several hundred acres of arable land. The work of the people is about .45 on the land and 2/3 who commute to the cities. Younger children are carried to school at Gt. Gidding, the older to Sawtry by the coach company, which has its garage off the village green. Transport, otherwise, is by private car, or by bus to Peterboro' once a week. The smallness of the village should not belie the fact that it has a lively community & existance, with
